xml.title: ケープ タウン ー Hartlepool Street Map
xml.description: It was founded in the 7th century AD, around the Northumbrian monastery of Hartlepool Abbey. The village grew during the Middle Ages and developed a harbour which served as the official port of the County palatine of Durham. A railway link to the South Durham coal fields in 1835 resulted in further expansion, with the establishing of the new town of West Hartlepool. 日本語 Map of Hartlepool on July 2010 Español Francés
